title: Telegraph Travel Awards 2015/16: win a £40,000 stay in Bangkok
text: A haven of calm on the banks of the Chao Phraya River, Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok is truly unique. Travellers have followed the river to stay at this luxury five-star hotel in one of the world’s most exciting cities to enjoy its legendary reputation for style and service excellence. Timeless yet contemporary, classic yet cutting-edge, its unique blend of luxury and comfort makes it the ultimate Bangkok address. In 2016 Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok, winner of more hotel accolades than any other including many Telegraph Travel Awards, will celebrate its 140th anniversary. The prize winner will have the unique opportunity to stay in The Grand Royal Suite in the original ‘Oriental Hotel’ following a complete restoration of its historic Author’s Wing. Guests will be among the first in the world to enjoy the new 600sq metre Grand Royal Suite with six bedrooms and private balcony. Value: £40,000 How to enter Follow this link to tell us about your favourite travel companies and destinations - and to enter the draw for one of 27 prizes . You will need to leave your name, telephone number and a valid email address. See here for full terms and conditions . The prize Celebrating 140 Years of Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok Three nights in The Grand Royal Suite in the fully restored original Authors’ Wing of ‘The Oriental Hotel’ celebrating its 140th anniversary in 2016 Chauffeured transfers in a BMW 7 series Afternoon Tea in the Author’s Lounge – The Authors’ Lounge is located in the oldest part of the hotel, which showcases a brand new tribute to the large number of famous writers and literary heavyweights who have stepped through the doors of The Oriental over the years Dinner at Le Normandie – Arguably Asia's finest French restaurant where the highest rated Michelin starred Master Chefs from all over the world regularly showcase their culinary achievements. Floor-to-ceiling glass panels provide diners with breathtaking panoramic views of the Chao Phraya River and stunning vistas of the City of Angels Cocktails in the Bamboo Bar – Following a unique refurbishment in December 2014, the bar retains its legacy as a classic cocktail bar and jazz venue with a contemporary look, whilst preserving the bar’s unique history and iconic character since 1953. A Culinary Journey - Experience the refined art of Thai cooking at the hotel’s Oriental Thai Cooking School, Bangkok’s oldest cooking school, with a morning visit to the local market with the Executive Thai Chef and a private lesson A Royal Journey - An exclusive tour of The Chakri Maha Prasart Throne Hall at The Grand Palace. This Royal court was built on the Royal command of King Chulalongkorn (Rama V) to commemorate the centenary of the Chakri Dynasty. The Throne Hall has hosted numerous state occasions to welcome foreign dignitaries and heads of state including Queen Elizabeth II in 1972. This most Royal journey ends with a private guided tour by the resident curator of the Grand Palace’s Queen Sirikit Museum of Textiles – one of the world’s most beautiful royal dress collections as well as a back-of-the-house laboratory tour. A Cultural Journey – A private long-tail boat tour of the Bangkok riverside and historic klongs (canals) along the majestic Chao Phraya River including stopovers at The Temple of Dawn and The Reclining Buddha at Wat Pho. A Heritage Journey – A private tour of the world’s largest golden teakwood mansion, Vimanmek Mansion Museum, built in 1900 by the Royal command of HM King Chulalongkorn (Rama V), and the famed museum of the legendary Thai Silk King, Jim Thompson – who was also an owner of The Oriental before his mysterious disappearance in the Cameroon Highlands. A Floral Journey – Mandarin Oriental Bangkok’s very own Floral Director leads a private tour of Bangkok’s Flower market with its intoxicating aromas and exotic flowers, followed by a one hour private floral design class. A Wellness & Spa Journey - Immerse in Thai wellness and meditation practices with 90-minutes of yoga and guided mediation with the hotel’s yogic healer. The session is followed by the Oriental Spa’s 90-minute Signature Customised Massage Treatment An Artistic Journey - an exclusive ‘insider tour’ by the curators of some of Bangkok’s most eclectic art galleries Contact: Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok, General Manager; Cleveland Collection, Managing Director, Frances Geoghegan The prize providers Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok Built in 1876 and ideally located on the banks of the Chao Phraya River, Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok has been an inspiration to a host of world-renowned writers from Joseph Conrad, Somerset Maugham to Wilbur Smith and John Le Carre. Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok boasts an international reputation for splendid service, style and grace and facilities including eight restaurants. The hotel’s private teakwood shuttle boats provide daily access to the world famous Thai Cooking School, the hotel’s Thai restaurant, the award-winning Oriental Spa and Health Centre located across the River; as well as the nearest skytrain station (SaphanTaksin) and Asiatique Night Market. Mandarin Oriental, Bangkok is a flagship property of Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group - having grown from a well-respected Asian hotel company into an award-winning global brand over 50 years, the Group now operates, or has under development, 46 hotels in 25 countries, with 21 hotels in Asia, nine in The Americas and 16 in Europe, Middle East and North Africa. Cleveland Collection Cleveland Collection is a Luxury Tour Operator crafting tailor-made travel arrangements to the most exciting destinations worldwide. Their reputation and expertise gives their clients access to the most unique and authentic experiences imaginable. From private islands to private villas, from small ship cruising to classic rail journeys and bespoke escorted tours, they allow you to see the world from a different perspective. Whether you are in search of an active adventure or a relaxing escape they offer advice to make your adventure truly your own. Our staff have all travelled extensively, and make recommendations from first-hand knowledge. They have breadth and depth of experience with impeccable local connections to bring you inspiring, once in a lifetime holidays.
